sect1.title: How Firewall Builder works with Cisco ASA Firewalls
sect1.para: Conceptually Firewall Builder works the same way no matter what type of firewall is being configured. Firewall Builder is based on the idea of using objects to represent rule elements, such as IP networks Host addresses, and then using these objects to define firewalll rules.

For Cisco ASA and Cisco PIX firewalls after the firewall rules have been created Firewall Builder will generate a configuration file that contains all the Cisco CLI commands required to implement the user defined security policy. This configuration file can also include information required to configure interfaces, static routes and other configuration options.

Once the configuration file has been created Firewall Builder can use the secure SSH and SCP protocols to transfer the configuration to the Cisco ASA or PIX firewall and to activate the generated configuration, or user's can manually copy-and-paste the generated configuration file onto a command line session.
